titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: We rose early, & left Durham by the 8.20 a.m. express, arriving in London about 1.30 p.m. We drove at once to 21 Clivenden Street, Eaton Square, where Mary & Linetta have their abode. I went away & got my hair cut & then returned to have tea.
We travelled to Canterbury by the 4.20 p.m. from Victoria, arriving about 6.20 p.m. The Bishop of Dover came to dinner.
